title: A bill to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to allow qualifying States to use all or any portion of their allotments under the State Children's Health Insurance Program for certain Medicaid expenditures.
content: Amends title XXI (SCHIP) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to allow qualifying states to use all or any portion of their allotments under SCHIP for certain Medicaid expenditures. Requires qualifying states to meet at least three of certain policies and procedures, including: (1) a simplified application process, (2) elimination of any asset test, (3) twelve-month continuous eligibility, and (4) easy access to enrollment staff.
